page.title: 04Lifespan Commune Carlecotes
page.content: This registered workers collective owns and occupies two rows of terraced houses. The {Commune}was set up in 1974 with a few couples and their children which attracted quite a bit of television coverage during their first few years. The population of the group has varied and at the present time there are 11 adults and 5 children who are involved with childcare, domestic duties, gardening, building maintenance, craft workshops and a printing business which is the main source of income. Their aims are to co-operatively, develop new sorts of relationships and offer an alternative to the {nuclear {family.}Though isolated their members are socially and politically active and have an open invitation policy to encourage growth for the future.
